item.title: HK protesters bid farewell to camp
item.description: Protesters say police plans to clear their camps will not end their fight.
item.ExtractedText: << Previous Â Next >> More than two months of pro-democracy protests that have transformed districts around Hong Kong could be coming to an abrupt end this week. Protesters have occupied major roads around the city to try and pressure the government into holding open elections for the city's next leader, but the government has denounced the protest as "illegal," "dangerous," and "radical," while refusing to offer concessions. Police say they plan Thursday to clear the main protest site. Photography by Willfred Chan, CNN Text by Wilfred Chan and Jethro Mullen, CNN Loading weather data ...
